00037 #include "midas.h"
00038 #include "msystem.h"
00039 #include "c:\provnt21\include\fbvspch.h"
00040 
00041 char mtUserStr[128], mtTalkStr[128];
00042 BOOL debug = FALSE;
00043 DWORD shutupTime = 10;
00044 
00045 LPSTR lpPhonetics;
00046 LPSPEECHBLOCK lpSCB;
00047 
00048 char *type_name[] = {
00049    "ERROR",
00050    "INFO",
00051    "DEBUG" "USER",
00052    "LOG",
00053    "TALK",
00054    "CALL",
00055 };

00057 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00058 
00059 /*----- receive_message --------------------------------------------*/
00060 
00061 void receive_message(HNDLE hBuf, HNDLE id, EVENT_HEADER * header, void *message)
00062 {
00063    char str[256], *pc, *sp;
00064    static DWORD last_beep = 0;
00065 
00066    /* print message */
00067    printf("%s\n", (char *) (message));
00068 
00069    if (debug) {
00070       printf("evID:%hx Mask:%hx Serial:%li Size:%ld\n", header->event_id,
00071              header->trigger_mask, header->serial_number, header->data_size);
00072       pc = strchr((char *) (message), ']') + 2;
00073    }
00074 
00075    /* skip none talking message */
00076    if (header->trigger_mask == MT_TALK || header->trigger_mask == MT_USER) {
00077       pc = strchr((char *) (message), ']') + 2;
00078       sp = pc + strlen(pc) - 1;
00079       while (*sp == ' ' || *sp == '\t')
00080          sp--;
00081       *(++sp) = '\0';
00082       if (debug) {
00083          printf("<%s>", pc);
00084          printf(" sending msg to festival\n");
00085       }
00086 
00087       /* Send beep first */
00088       // for windows, send the wav directly
00089       if ((ss_time() - last_beep) > shutupTime) {
00090          switch (header->trigger_mask) {
00091          case MT_TALK:
00092             if (mtTalkStr[0])
00093                sprintf(str, mtTalkStr);
00094             break;
00095          case MT_USER:
00096             if (mtUserStr[0])
00097                sprintf(str, mtUserStr);
00098             break;
00099          }
00100 
00101          while (SpeechStatus(lpSCB) != 0)
00102             ss_sleep(1000);
00103          ss_sleep(500);
00104 
00105          PlaySound(str, NULL, SND_SYNC);
00106          last_beep = ss_time();
00107          ss_sleep(200);
00108       }
00109 
00110       while (SpeechStatus(lpSCB) != 0)
00111          ss_sleep(1000);
00112       ss_sleep(500);
00113 
00114       lpPhonetics = TextToPhonetics(lpSCB, pc, 0);
00115       SpeakPhonetics(lpSCB, lpPhonetics);
00116       //  save phonetics to .wav file
00117       //  WritePhonetics(lpSCB, lpPhonetics, "hello.wav");
00118    }
00119 
00120    return;
00121 }
00122 
00123 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00124 
00125 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00126 {
00127    INT status, i, ch;
00128    char host_name[NAME_LENGTH];
00129    char exp_name[NAME_LENGTH];
00130 
00131    /* get default from environment */
00132    cm_get_environment(host_name, exp_name);
00133 
00134    /* parse command line parameters */
00135    for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
00136       if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'd')
00137          debug = TRUE;
00138       else if (argv[i][0] == '-') {
00139          if (i + 1 >= argc || argv[i + 1][0] == '-')
00140             goto usage;
00141          if (argv[i][1] == 'e')
00142             strcpy(exp_name, argv[++i]);
00143          else if (argv[i][1] == 'h')
00144             strcpy(host_name, argv[++i]);
00145          else if (argv[i][1] == 't')
00146             strcpy(mtTalkStr, argv[++i]);
00147          else if (argv[i][1] == 'u')
00148             strcpy(mtUserStr, argv[++i]);
00149          else if (argv[i][1] == 's')
00150             shutupTime = atoi(argv[++i]);
00151          else {
00152           usage:
00153             printf("usage: mspeaker [-h Hostname] [-e Experiment]\n\n");
00154             printf("                [-t mt_talk] Specify the mt_talk alert command\n");
00155             printf("                [-u mt_user] Specify the mt_user alert command\n");
00156             printf
00157                 ("                [-s shut up time] Specify the min time interval between alert [s]\n");
00158             printf
00159                 ("                The -t & -u switch require a command equivalent to:\n");
00160             printf("                'mspeaker -t talkbeep.wav -u userclap.wav'\n");
00161             return 0;
00162          }
00163       }
00164    }
00165 
00166    //  register to SB
00167    // lpSCB = OpenSpeech(0, 0, "Esnb1k8"); 
00168    lpSCB = OpenSpeech(0, 0, "ESNB2K6");
00169    // lpSCB = OpenSpeech(0, 0, NULL); 
00170    if (lpSCB == NULL) {
00171       printf("Cannot allocate Speech Control Block\n");
00172       goto out;
00173    } else {
00174       status = lpSCB->speechStatus;
00175       if ((status <= E_SPEECH_ERROR) && (status > W_SPEECH_WARNING)) {
00176          printf("Open Speech error:%d\n", status);
00177          goto out;
00178       }
00179    }
00180 
00181    lpPhonetics = NULL;
00182 
00183  reconnect:
00184 
00185    /* now connect to server */
00186    status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, exp_name, "Speaker", NULL);
00187    if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
00188       return 1;
00189 
00190    cm_msg_register(receive_message);
00191 
00192    printf("Midas Message Talker connected to %s. Press \"!\" to exit\n",
00193           host_name[0] ? host_name : "local host");
00194 
00195    do {
00196       status = cm_yield(1000);
00197       if (ss_kbhit()) {
00198          ch = getch();
00199          if (ch == 'r')
00200             ss_clear_screen();
00201          if (ch == '!')
00202             break;
00203       }
00204 
00205       if (status == SS_ABORT) {
00206          cm_disconnect_experiment();
00207          printf("Trying to reconnect...\n");
00208          ss_sleep(3000);
00209          goto reconnect;
00210       }
00211 
00212    } while (status != RPC_SHUTDOWN);
00213 
00214  out:
00215 
00216    CloseSpeech(lpSCB);
00217    if (lpPhonetics)
00218       FreePhoneticsBuffer(lpPhonetics);
00219 
00220    cm_disconnect_experiment();
00221    return 1;
00222 }
